did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.abstract: This World War I memorabilia collection consists of a wall banner, a Campaign Medal, a ticket, draft registration card, and a photograph.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World War I Memorabilia, 1917, in the Josesph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection, Accession #10875-v, Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items were given to the University of Virginia Library by Matthew J. Bruccoli, Columbia, South Carolina, on January 13, 1994.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These additions to the Joseph M. Bruccoli Great War Collection consist of a World War I campaign medal belonging to Joseph M. Bruccoli with bars for the eight battles in which he fought; his draft registration certificate in the Bronx, N.Y., 1917; his ticket for meals and lifeboat station aboard the Carpathia; issues of Sea Life, v. 1, no. 15 and 16, published on the U.S. Harrisonburg; a photograph of Poincare decorating General Petain; and a wall banner produced by the Disabled American Veterans. Issues of Sea Life(Published on board the USS Harrisonburg) have been separately cataloged as: D501 .S43.
